prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories: A five-month-old baby endured a cardiac arrest at the theme park, Legoland Windsor, last Thursday. A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was apprehended on suspicion of child neglect in connection to the incident. The baby is currently in critical condition at the hospital. The woman has been released on bail until July 26th. Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit is heading the investigation, and they are appealing for anyone with information regarding the incident, particularly those who were in the queue for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm. The public is urged to avoid speculation and to respect the family's privacy during this difficult time. No other suspects are being sought in relation to the incident. Legoland Windsor issued a statement expressing their support for the ongoing investigation and confirming that their trained First Aid team responded immediately when the baby took ill. To send story ideas to BBC South, you can contact them via email, Facebook, Instagram, or WhatsApp at 0808 100 2240. The BBC is not liable for the content of external sites.

The Essex woman, aged 27, from Witham is being investigated for suspected child neglect in relation to the incident. The baby is currently in critical condition at the hospital, and the woman has been released on bail until July 26th. Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit is leading the investigation and appeals for any information concerning the incident, specifically from those in the Coastguard HQ boat ride queue between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm. The public is asked to avoid spreading rumors and to give the family privacy during this challenging period. No other individuals are being pursued in connection to the incident. Legoland Windsor released a statement, expressing their cooperation with the investigation and verifying that their First Aid team acted promptly when the baby fell ill.
